required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-Interventional Study In Patients With Ocular Hypertension And Open Angle Glaucoma Treated With Xalatan And Xalacom

brief_summary.textblock: Non-interventional study to obtain real life data from the treatment with Xalatan and Xalacom in Germany and to assess the long-term efficacy and tolerability under routine conditions. Data were entered into an electronic case report form.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
Change From Baseline in Optic Disc Excavation: Vertical Cup to Disc Ratio
Change From Baseline in Optic Disc Excavation: Horizontal Cup to Disc Ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject Assessment of Satisfaction With Xalatan® Treatment
Subject Self-care: Application of Eye Drops
Reasons for Changes in Glaucoma Therapy
Investigator Assessment of Tolerability of Xalatan® Treatment
Changes to the Color of the Iris During Xalatan® or Xalacom® Treatment

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients with glaucoma and ocular hypertension

intervention.arm_group_label: patients with glaucoma and ocular hypertension

study_pop.textblock: patients with glaucoma or ocular hypertension treated by office-based ophthalmologists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with ocular hypertension or glaucoma, defined by SmPC
Exclusion Criteria:
- defined by SmPC

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Open-label, prospective, multi-center, non-interventional cohort study (NIS) at 385 centers (office-based ophthalmologists); number of subjects per center was not limited.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were assigned to a therapeutic strategy within current practice and not according to a protocol.

group.title: Subjects With Glaucoma and Ocular Hypertension
group.description: All subjects group: documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension at baseline visit; includes subjects from the 4 treatment groups: Xalatan®: subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit; Betablockers: subjects with only 1 betablocker and subjects with more than one betablocker at baseline visit; Xalacom®: subjects with Xalacom® (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit; other medications: subjects with other or no hypotensive therapy at baseline visit.

participants_list.participants: More than 1 discontinuation (DC) reason possible per subject. See outcome measure Reasons for DC.

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

group.title: Betablockers
group.description: Subjects with only 1 betablocker and subjects with more than one betablocker at baseline visit

group.title: Xalacom®
group.description: Subjects with Xalacom® (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit

group.title: Other Medication
group.description: Subjects with other or no hypotensive therapy at baseline visit

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Concomitant ocular diseases at baseline
measure.description: Number of subjects per type of concomitant ocular diseases present at baseline visit for right eye (OD) and left eye (OS). Column numbers may not equal the total number of participants analyzed as subjects could meet criteria for more than 1 category.

class.title: Status post laser surgery for glaucoma OD
Status post laser surgery for glaucoma OS

measure.title: Concomitant systemic diseases at baseline
measure.description: Number of subjects per type of concomitant systemic disease present at baseline visit. Column numbers may not equal the total number of participants analyzed as subjects could meet criteria for more than one category.

measure.title: Glaucoma diagnosis at baseline
measure.description: Number of subjects per each type of glaucoma diagnosis present at baseline visit for OD and OS. Column numbers may not equal the total number of participants analyzed as subjects could meet criteria for more than one category.

measure.title: Duration of glaucoma disease at baseline
measure.description: Duration in years for glaucoma disease present at baseline visit.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
outcome.description: Mean IOP values measured by applanation tonometry. Only Goldman values are displayed; if values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed. Change (absolute difference) calculated as mean of (value of IOP at observation minus baseline value). Study course is reported by yearly intervals and clustered as 1 year (12±3 months), 2 years (24±3 months), and 3 years (36±3 months).
outcome.population: All subjects group and each treatment group population. N=number of participants with IOP data at baseline; (n)=number of participants with analyzable data at observation for All subjects, Xalatan®, Betablockers, Xalacom®, and Other medications, respectively.

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension at baseline visit; includes subjects from the 4 treatment groups.

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

group.title: Betablockers
group.description: Subjects with only 1 betablocker and subjects with more than one betablocker at baseline visit.

group.title: Xalacom®
group.description: Subjects with Xalacom® (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit

group.title: Other Medications
group.description: Subjects with other or no hypotensive therapy at baseline visit.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
measure.description: Mean IOP values measured by applanation tonometry. Only Goldman values are displayed; if values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed. Change (absolute difference) calculated as mean of (value of IOP at observation minus baseline value). Study course is reported by yearly intervals and clustered as 1 year (12±3 months), 2 years (24±3 months), and 3 years (36±3 months).
measure.population: All subjects group and each treatment group population. N=number of participants with IOP data at baseline; (n)=number of participants with analyzable data at observation for All subjects, Xalatan®, Betablockers, Xalacom®, and Other medications, respectively.

outcome.title: Aulhorn Stage (Visual Field Defects)
outcome.description: Number of subjects at each Aulhorn stage. Staged as: No scotoma; Stage I (relative scotomas only), Stage II (absolute scotomas without connection to the blind spot), Stage III (absolute scotomas with connection to the blind spot), Stage IV (absolute scotomas more than 1 quadrant affected), and Stage V (temporal residual visual field only). If values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed.
outcome.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension at baseline visit; includes subjects from the 4 treatment groups.

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

group.title: Betablockers
group.description: Subjects with only 1 betablocker and subjects with more than one betablocker at baseline visit.

group.title: Xalacom®
group.description: Subjects with Xalacom® (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit

group.title: Other Medications
group.description: Subjects with other or no hypotensive therapy at baseline visit.

measure.title: Aulhorn Stage (Visual Field Defects)
measure.description: Number of subjects at each Aulhorn stage. Staged as: No scotoma; Stage I (relative scotomas only), Stage II (absolute scotomas without connection to the blind spot), Stage III (absolute scotomas with connection to the blind spot), Stage IV (absolute scotomas more than 1 quadrant affected), and Stage V (temporal residual visual field only). If values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed.
measure.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Optic Disc Excavation: Vertical Cup to Disc Ratio
outcome.description: Mean vertical cup to disc (cup/disc or C/D) ratio to assess the progression of glaucoma; calculated as the ratio of the diameter of the depression (cup) to that of the optical nerve head (disc). If values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed. Change calculated as mean of (value of cup/disc ratio at observation minus baseline value).
outcome.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations. N=number of participants with optic disc excavation data at baseline; (n)=number of participants with analyzable data at observation for All subjects, Xalatan®, Betablockers, Xalacom®, and Other medications, respectively.

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension at baseline visit; includes subjects from the 4 treatment groups.

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

group.title: Betablockers
group.description: Subjects with only 1 betablocker and subjects with more than one betablocker at baseline visit.

group.title: Xalacom®
group.description: Subjects with Xalacom® (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit

group.title: Other Medications
group.description: Subjects with other or no hypotensive therapy at baseline visit.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Optic Disc Excavation: Vertical Cup to Disc Ratio
measure.description: Mean vertical cup to disc (cup/disc or C/D) ratio to assess the progression of glaucoma; calculated as the ratio of the diameter of the depression (cup) to that of the optical nerve head (disc). If values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed. Change calculated as mean of (value of cup/disc ratio at observation minus baseline value).
measure.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations. N=number of participants with optic disc excavation data at baseline; (n)=number of participants with analyzable data at observation for All subjects, Xalatan®, Betablockers, Xalacom®, and Other medications, respectively.

outcome.description: Mean horizontal cup to disc (cup/disc or C/D) ratio to assess the progression of glaucoma; calculated as the ratio of the diameter of the depression (cup) to that of the optical nerve head (disc). If values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed. Change calculated as mean of (value of cup/disc ratio at observation minus baseline value).
outcome.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations. N=number of subjects with optic disc excavation data at baseline; (n)=number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for All subjects, Xalatan®, Betablockers, Xalacom®, and Other medications, respectively.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Optic Disc Excavation: Horizontal Cup to Disc Ratio
measure.description: Mean horizontal cup to disc (cup/disc or C/D) ratio to assess the progression of glaucoma; calculated as the ratio of the diameter of the depression (cup) to that of the optical nerve head (disc). If values were given for both right and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed. Change calculated as mean of (value of cup/disc ratio at observation minus baseline value).
measure.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations. N=number of subjects with optic disc excavation data at baseline; (n)=number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for All subjects, Xalatan®, Betablockers, Xalacom®, and Other medications, respectively.

outcome.title: Investigator Assessment of Xalatan® Efficacy
outcome.description: Number of subjects for Investigator assessment of the efficacy of Xalatan® treatment rated as excellent (highly effective), very good, good, moderate, sufficient, and insufficient (not effective).
outcome.population: Xalatan® treatment group only (subjects with Xalatan® monotherapy at baseline visit).

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

measure.title: Investigator Assessment of Xalatan® Efficacy
measure.description: Number of subjects for Investigator assessment of the efficacy of Xalatan® treatment rated as excellent (highly effective), very good, good, moderate, sufficient, and insufficient (not effective).
measure.population: Xalatan® treatment group only (subjects with Xalatan® monotherapy at baseline visit).

outcome.title: Subject Assessment of Satisfaction With Xalatan® Treatment
outcome.description: Number of subjects for assessment of subject satisfaction with Xalatan® treatment; categorized as excellent (full satisfaction), very good, good, moderate, sufficient, and insufficient (no satisfaction).
outcome.population: Xalatan® treatment group only (subjects with Xalatan monotherapy at baseline visit).

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

measure.title: Subject Assessment of Satisfaction With Xalatan® Treatment
measure.description: Number of subjects for assessment of subject satisfaction with Xalatan® treatment; categorized as excellent (full satisfaction), very good, good, moderate, sufficient, and insufficient (no satisfaction).
measure.population: Xalatan® treatment group only (subjects with Xalatan monotherapy at baseline visit).

outcome.title: Visual Acuity (Visus)
outcome.description: Number of subjects with visual acuity evaluations: amaurosis (partial or total loss of sight); hand movements (able to detect gross object and motion perception without detailed discrimination); finger count (able to count fingers at a given distance); visual acuity scale: range 0.05 (low acuity) to >1.2 (greater acuity). If values were given for both the right eye and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed.
outcome.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension at baseline visit; includes subjects from the 4 treatment groups.

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

group.title: Betablockers
group.description: Subjects with only 1 betablocker and subjects with more than one betablocker at baseline visit.

group.title: Xalacom®
group.description: Subjects with Xalacom® (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit

group.title: Other Medications
group.description: Subjects with other or no hypotensive therapy at baseline visit.

measure.title: Visual Acuity (Visus)
measure.description: Number of subjects with visual acuity evaluations: amaurosis (partial or total loss of sight); hand movements (able to detect gross object and motion perception without detailed discrimination); finger count (able to count fingers at a given distance); visual acuity scale: range 0.05 (low acuity) to >1.2 (greater acuity). If values were given for both the right eye and left eye, the value of the right eye was analyzed.
measure.population: All subjects group and all treatment groups populations

outcome.title: Visual Impairment Due to Glaucoma
outcome.description: Number of subjects per level of visual impairment categorized as not at all (no impairment), a little bit, moderate, severe, and very severe (very severe impairment).
outcome.population: All subjects group; not summarized by subgroups

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension and a documented glaucoma medication at baseline visit.

measure.title: Visual Impairment Due to Glaucoma
measure.description: Number of subjects per level of visual impairment categorized as not at all (no impairment), a little bit, moderate, severe, and very severe (very severe impairment).
measure.population: All subjects group; not summarized by subgroups

outcome.title: Subject Self-care: Application of Eye Drops
outcome.description: Number of subjects per level of ability for application (administration) of eye drops categorized as without the help of nursing staff (apply without help) and with the help of nursing staff (apply with help).
outcome.population: All subjects group; not summarized by subgroups

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension and a documented glaucoma medication at baseline visit.

measure.title: Subject Self-care: Application of Eye Drops
measure.description: Number of subjects per level of ability for application (administration) of eye drops categorized as without the help of nursing staff (apply without help) and with the help of nursing staff (apply with help).
measure.population: All subjects group; not summarized by subgroups

outcome.title: Reasons for Changes in Glaucoma Therapy
outcome.description: Number of subjects for each reason for change of therapy; there may be more than one reason possible per patient. Reasons for changes in glaucoma therapy was reported from January 2000 through December 2008 independent of the duration of any individual subject's time on study.
outcome.population: Subjects from the all subjects group that changed therapy through the duration of the study; subjects who changed from or changed to "other" therapy (Other Medication) were not included in this analysis; not summarized by subgroups.

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension and a documented glaucoma medication at baseline visit.

measure.title: Reasons for Changes in Glaucoma Therapy
measure.description: Number of subjects for each reason for change of therapy; there may be more than one reason possible per patient. Reasons for changes in glaucoma therapy was reported from January 2000 through December 2008 independent of the duration of any individual subject's time on study.
measure.population: Subjects from the all subjects group that changed therapy through the duration of the study; subjects who changed from or changed to "other" therapy (Other Medication) were not included in this analysis; not summarized by subgroups.

outcome.title: Investigator Assessment of Tolerability of Xalatan® Treatment
outcome.description: Number of subjects for the Investigator's assessment of subjects tolerability of Xalatan® treatment categorized as excellent, very good, good, moderate, sufficient, or insufficient. The occurrence of adverse events (a side effect that may not have any causal relationship to study treatment) was documented as tolerability data.
outcome.population: Xalatan® treatment group only (subjects with Xalatan monotherapy at baseline visit).

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

measure.title: Investigator Assessment of Tolerability of Xalatan® Treatment
measure.description: Number of subjects for the Investigator's assessment of subjects tolerability of Xalatan® treatment categorized as excellent, very good, good, moderate, sufficient, or insufficient. The occurrence of adverse events (a side effect that may not have any causal relationship to study treatment) was documented as tolerability data.
measure.population: Xalatan® treatment group only (subjects with Xalatan monotherapy at baseline visit).

outcome.title: Reasons for Discontinuation From Study
outcome.description: Number of subjects per reason for discontinuation from the study. More than one reason for discontinuation is possible per patient. Discontinuation analysis was performed independent of the duration of any individual subject's time on study.
outcome.population: Subjects from the All subjects group population who discontinued the study.

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension and a documented glaucoma medication at baseline visit.

measure.title: Reasons for Discontinuation From Study
measure.description: Number of subjects per reason for discontinuation from the study. More than one reason for discontinuation is possible per patient. Discontinuation analysis was performed independent of the duration of any individual subject's time on study.
measure.population: Subjects from the All subjects group population who discontinued the study.

outcome.title: Changes to the Color of the Iris During Xalatan® or Xalacom® Treatment
outcome.description: Number of subjects with documented change to the color of the iris during treatment with Xalatan® or Xalacom®.
outcome.population: Xalatan® treatment group (subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit) and Xalacom® treatment group (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit. During the course of the study the data structure (scaling of color) was changed in a way that change in iris color was no longer evaluable; data not summarized.

group.title: Xalatan®
group.description: Subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit

group.title: Xalacom®
group.description: Subjects with Xalacom® (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit

measure.title: Changes to the Color of the Iris During Xalatan® or Xalacom® Treatment
measure.description: Number of subjects with documented change to the color of the iris during treatment with Xalatan® or Xalacom®.
measure.population: Xalatan® treatment group (subjects with Xalatan® (latanoprost) monotherapy at baseline visit) and Xalacom® treatment group (latanoprost + timolol maleate) therapy at baseline visit. During the course of the study the data structure (scaling of color) was changed in a way that change in iris color was no longer evaluable; data not summarized.

reported_events.time_frame: Data for Adverse drug reactions was reported January 2000 through December 2008 through the duration of the study independent of the duration of any individual subject's time on study.
reported_events.desc: Side effects = Adverse drug reactions: determination by the health-care professional of causal relationship between occurrence of side effect and drug being used; includes ocular and systemic side effects. Reported for All subjects group population.

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Subjects with documented diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension at baseline visit.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Except at baseline, number of subjects analyzed in treatment groups do not necessarily summarize to “All subjects” total; subjects drop out of treatment group when therapy changes. “All subjects” shows all subjects irrespective of any therapy change.
